refnamediv.refpurpose: Determines if a name corresponds to a program object

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: glIsProgram returns GL_TRUE if program is the name of a program object previously created with glCreateProgram and not yet deleted with glDeleteProgram. If program is zero or a non-zero value that is not the name of a program object, or if an error occurs, glIsProgram returns GL_FALSE.

refsect1.title: Notes
refsect1.para: glIsProgram is available only if the GL version is 2.0 or greater.
No error is generated if program is not a valid program object name.
A program object marked for deletion with glDeleteProgram but still in use as part of current rendering state is still considered a program object and glIsProgram will return GL_TRUE.

refsect1.title: Errors
refsect1.para: GL_INVALID_OPERATION is generated if glIsProgram is executed between the execution of glBegin and the corresponding execution of glEnd.

refsect1.title: Associated Gets
refsect1.para: glGetActiveAttrib with arguments program and the index of an active attribute variable
glGetActiveUniform with arguments program and the index of an active uniform variable
glGetAttribLocation with arguments program and the name of an attribute variable
glGetProgram with arguments program and the parameter to be queried
glGetUniform with arguments program and the location of a uniform variable
glGetUniformLocation with arguments program and the name of a uniform variable
